heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 21 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (190°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 1.9°C) and inside temperature (down 1.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 12%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 923 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 53.6°C), dew point temperature (up 48.5°C), outside temperature (up 52.4°C), and cloud levels (up 548 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 922.9m lower than yesterday, 548.1m lower than the past week, 437.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1011m to a maximum of 4080m, averaging 1269.5m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1817.6m and 1707.0m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. Showers, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and the light is absent. Weather should be calm and steady.
